page.title: 17TRANSPORT
page.content: COMMUNICATIONS HAVE ALWAYS BEEN VERY IMPORTANT IN NORTHWICH.THE FACT THAT IT WAS A GOOD POINT TO CROSS THE RIVER WEAVER ON THE WAY TO CHESTER AND COULD BE DEFENDED EASILY ARE THE REASONS THE TOWN GREW IN ROMAN TIMES. IN MORE RECENT TIMES COMMUNICATIONS BY ROAD CROSSED AT NORTHWICH (OVER THE RIVER WEAVER) MAKING THE AREA ONCE AGAIN A MAJOR COMMUNICATION CENTRE.THE RIVER WAS WIDENED TO ALLOW FOR THE PASSAGE OF CARGO VESSELS FROM THE SALT MINES AT WINSFORD.ALSO SWING BRIDGES WERE ERECTED TO ALLOW ROAD AND RIVER TRAFFIC TO MOVE FREELY. MANY PEOPLE COMMUTE DAILY TO LIVERPOOL AND MANCHESTER AND IN A SMALL SURVEY THAT WE CARRIED OUT,86% OF HOMES HAD TELEPHONES,AND 92% HAD AT LEAST ONE CAR.THESE FACTS SHOW THE INCREASING IMPORTANCE OF COMMUNICATIONS IN THE NORTHWICH BLOCK IN 1985.
